intro: Fagonia taeckholmiana, commonly known as the desert fagonia, is a shrub native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to extreme drought conditions. Its structure is compact, with multiple branching stems that help it withstand harsh environmental conditions. Fagonia taeckholmiana is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ability to thrive in poor soil.
